alert.note: Alert for Owyhee Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 22 at 8:15AM MDT until July 24 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY COULD CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... .Gusty westerly winds will increase across southwestern Idaho and extreme southeastern Oregon, especially near the NV border, during the afternoon and evening hours Sunday and Monday with low relative humidity. This may result in critical fire weather conditions. Isolated thunderstorms with gusty outflow winds and little rainfall will be an additional concern, mainly in southwestern Idaho. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES AND LIGHTNING FOR OWYHEE MOUNTAINS...WHICH IS FIRE WEATHER ZONE 423... * WINDS...Southwest to west winds 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph Sunday and Monday afternoon and evening. A brief reduction in winds is expected on late Sunday night into Monday morning. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 14 percent. * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated thunderstorms across much of southwest Idaho. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusty and erratic outflow winds up to 40 mph are possible with stronger thunderstorms. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
